The date when Benioff initially made the controversial comments supporting Trump's use of National Guard troops, which sparked immediate criticism and backlash.

keyTakeAways: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, initially suggested that President Donald Trump should deploy the National Guard to San Francisco, sparking widespread criticism.

Benioff later retracted his comments, stating that he no longer believes the National Guard is needed in the city after consulting local officials and considering the large attendance at the Dreamforce conference.
His earlier support for federal troop deployment in Democratic-led cities was seen as a significant shift in political alignment, especially in a liberal-leaning Bay Area region.
The controversy led to internal fallout, including venture capitalist Ron Conway resigning from the Salesforce Foundation board.

The New York Times reported that Salesforce had previously pitched its AI tools to support Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) operations, including using AI to evaluate tips and improve deportations.

Salesforce has a history of government contracts, including work with ICE under both the Obama and Biden administrations, which raised concerns about its political alignment and use of technology in enforcement actions.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce, initially suggested that President Donald Trump send the National Guard to San Francisco to address safety concerns, a statement that drew immediate backlash from both the public and within his own circle. After the annual Dreamforce conference drew tens of thousands to the city, Benioff retracted his comments, apologizing for causing concern and stating that local officials and the event’s scale made the National Guard unnecessary. The controversy highlights a broader shift among tech leaders in the Bay Area toward supporting Trump’s policies. Additionally, internal reports indicate that Salesforce has historically supported ICE operations, including using AI to evaluate tips and improve deportation efforts, raising ethical and political questions about the company’s alignment with federal enforcement agendas.
title: Marc Benioff apologizes for suggesting National Guard be sent to San Francisco
